column4: how can check what speed my network card connected to my switch at? eg 100mbit, 1gbps etc ?
mii-tool ethX
SIOCGMIIPHY on 'eth0' failed: Operation not permitted
sudo mii-tool
sudo mii-tool ethYourInterface
no, how many interfaces do you have?
just eth0 and loopback
so 'sudo mii-tool eth0' returns the operation not permitted error
i can't help you i guess it's not supported :-) what type of network card is it?
an on board nforce 4 gigabit nic
okay.. do you know where I can configure the various features of the network card - jumbo packets etc?
i have no experience with setting options for the nvnet driver
yes you can put them in /etc/modprobe.d/<yourdrivername>
but the options are driver specific...are you using the nvnet driver? lsmod |grep nvnet
looks like I'm using the default forcedeth driver
check this out http://download.nvidia.com/XFree86/nforce/1.0-0310/ReleaseNotes.html you can put options like force_speed_duplex=4 for 100Mbps/Full
just an example...
9 = gigabit full duplex
stop networking: /etc/init.d/networking stop then rmmod forcedeth and modprobe forcedeth <your_options)
there is no nvnet in your ubuntu kernel
no just use your forcedeth with the options
:-) ethtool...forgot about that one!
just try the options in the release notes: modprobe forcedeth force_speed_duplex=9 mtu=bla
np :-)
